Makes sanitizer violations fatal in production to stop exploits that may lead to code execution, privilege escalation, denial of service, data tampering, information disclosure.
Typically it is combined with ASan inspired sanitizer (ASan, HWASan, GWP-ASan) and UBSan. TC-Malloc and Scudo have GWP-ASan, a production ready and sample based address sanitizer, but need to be LD_PRELOADed.
The GWP-ASan has a performance penalty that is acceptable for production use but with tradeoffs of not checking every allocation, delayed use after free detection, and not performing stack error detection.
